name: Path N Fallopian Tube
title: Pathologic N
notes:
**Note 1:** Histological examination of a pelvic lymphadenectomy specimen will ordinarily include 6 or more lymph nodes. If the examined lymph nodes are negative, but the number ordinarily examined is not met, classify as pN0. (FIGO considers such cases as pNX). (1)

**Note 2:**  Code only regional nodes and nodes, NOS, in this field.  Regional nodes include bilateral and contralateral involvement of named nodes.  Distant nodes, including presacral and lateral sacral (laterosacral) nodes, are coded in distant metastasis. 

**Note 3:**  The Federation Internationale de Gynecologie et d'Obstetrique (FIGO) Stage IIIC is assigned based on tumor extension and/or regional lymph node involvement.  Code Regional Lymph Nodes based on a physician's statement of FIGO Stage IIIC  if  the stage value is assigned because of regional lymph node involvement or there is no indication of the basis.

**Note 4:**  If either exploratory or definitive surgery is done with no mention of lymph nodes, assume nodes are negative.

**Note 5:**  If the clinician says "adnexa palpated" but does not mention lymph nodes, assume lymph nodes are not involved.

**Regional lymph nodes:**

    Aortic, NOS:
        Lateral (lumbar)
        Para-aortic
        Periaortic   
    Iliac, NOS:
        Common
        External
        Internal (hypogastric)
            Obturator
    Inguinal
    Pelvic, NOS
    Retroperitoneal
footnotes: (1) International Union Against Cancer (UICC) *TNM Classification of Malignant Tumors,* 7th ed., Sobin, LH, Gospodarowicz, M, Wittekind, CH, eds. New York: Wiley, 2009, pg., 230
rows: Reigonal lymph nodes cannot be assessed

Surgical resection of primary and pathologic assessment of regional nodes are done but involvement of regional nodes not stated
Surgical resection of primary and pathologic assessment of regional nodes are done but involvement of regional nodes not documented in patient record

Regional lymph node(s), NOS
Lymph nodes, NOS

FIGO Stage IIIC based on regional lymph node involvement

Stated as N1
Clinically no nodes positive and no pathologic evaluation of nodes
In situ case as defined by TNM and there is a resection of the primary but the nodes are not evaluated pathologically
Pathologic N is not defined for the specific site/histology

No pathologic evaluation of regional lymph nodes and case is not in situ
Regional lymph node(s) cannot be assessed pathologically
No resection of a known primary (not T0)
No surgical resection of primary tumor and no positive biopsy of the highest N 
Unknown if any pathologic assessment performed
